title: Environmental Science and Management (PhD) Virtual Information Session
description:
Build a Career at the Intersection of Science, Policy, and Environmental Impact 
 If you're ready to lead change on a global scale, our  PhD in Environmental Science and Management  can help you get there. 
 Designed for future researchers, policy experts, sustainability officers, and academic leaders, our program combines rigorous scientific training with real-world applications. You'll work alongside seasoned faculty and regional partners on research that addresses today’s most pressing environmental challenges—from climate resilience to water quality and ecosystem restoration. 
 Registration is LIVE for our Environmental Science and Management PhD virtual information session July 17 at 1:00 PM (EST) . Our PhD graduates are equipped to take on high-impact roles in: 
 
 Environmental policy and planning 
 Government and regulatory agencies 
 Sustainable business and corporate ESG leadership 
 Academic and nonprofit research 
 Consulting and environmental advocacy

title: MBA, Dual Degrees, & Graduate Certificates Virtual Information Session
description:
Your next leadership move starts here  Montclair’s  MBA programs  are built for professionals who are ready to lead with purpose—and back it up with strategy. Whether you’re climbing higher in your current role or ready to pivot into something new, our flexible, career-focused curriculum will help you build the skills, confidence, and connections to make it happen.  Registration is open for our  virtual information session July 23 at 9:30 AM (EST) . Join us to explore our MBA pathways and find the one that aligns with your goals. 
 If you are looking to increase your earning potential and get equipped with actionable skills perfectly suited to your program of interest, consider one of our graduate certificate programs: 
 
 Business Analytics (Certificate) Online 
 Digital Marketing (Certificate) Online 
 Accounting (Certificate) 
 Forensic Accounting (Certificate) 
 Human Resources Management (Certificate) Online 
 Professional Accounting (Certificate) 
 Project Management (Certificate) Online 
 Real Estate Development (Certificate)

title: Wawayanda State Park Paddle Boarding
description:
Join Campus Recreation for the new and exciting sport of stand up paddleboarding! We will head to the Wawayanda State Park for a relaxing, fun day on the water. The lake is 1.5 miles long with multiple islands that can be gone around making exploring fun.  
   How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration Opens on  6/23 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Rec Center main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10; Faculty/Staff $20 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 July 24, 2025 
 9:00 am - 5:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, bug spray, sunscreen, towel and bathing suit  
   
 Potential Hazards:  Unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration, allergic reactions/poisonous plants, and insect bites.

title: Child Advocacy and Policy (MA) and Child Advocacy (Certificate) Virtual Information Session
description:
When children and families face complex challenges, they need informed, compassionate professionals to stand up, speak out, and shape solutions. If you're ready to turn your commitment into action, we're here to help.  We're hosting a  virtual information session on July 24 at 5:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Online Master of Arts in Child Advocacy and Policy 
 Child Advocacy (Certificate) – Online 
 
 Why Montclair?  Completing the certificate program allows you to transfer all 15 credits towards the Master of Arts in Child Advocacy, in accordance with all related graduate policy.

title: Gathering Your Sources
description:
Gathering resources for a research project can seem like a challenge: there are so many variables to consider. This workshop will look at the criteria that should guide your selection of sources.  But it will largely be a tutorial on database searching – for both scholarly articles and books. Moreover, we will look at the relationship between selecting sources and refining a research topic.  I hope you can join us. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14675064

title: Social Research and Data Analysis, Data Collection and Management Certificate, Customer & User Experience Certificate Virtual Information Session
description:
Where Research Meets Real-World Impact 
 If you're drawn to understanding people and using research to guide better decisions, Montclair’s graduate programs can help you turn that instinct into a powerful career path.  
 Why Montclair? 
 
 30-credit MA in  Social Research & Data Analysis  you can finish in just 16 months 
 The chance to stack your degree with fully online certificates in  Customer Experience and User Experience Research   and  Data Collection and Management 
 Real-world tools like R, SPSS, NVivo, and Qualtrics—plus support through mentorship, job leads, and career coaching 
 Paths to roles in UX, market research, education, public policy, and beyond 
 
 Registration is LIVE for our webinar July 29 at 6:00 PM (EST)   to get an inside look at programs that bridge human insight with data-driven decision-making.

title: Strategic Communications & Media (MA) Virtual Information Session
description:
Start where you are, we'll help you build the rest     
 Our  Strategic Communication & Media   students gain preparation to step into roles that matter leading teams, shaping policy, transforming communities, and solving real-world challenges across industries. Whether you're looking to advance in your current field or pivot into something new, you'll find a path here that aligns with your goals. 
 Tune into an upcoming virtual information session: 
 
 Wednesday, July 30 at 7:00 PM (EST) 
 
 What makes Montclair different?   
 
 You can complete our program in as little as 12 months 
 Flexible, non-sequential course structure so you can start in any semester 
 Optional hybrid Industry Bootcamp 
 Micro-credentials while earning degree for immediate skill application 
 No GRE required 
 
 A  graduate program at Montclair isn’t just about leveling up your education—it’s about expanding what’s possible for your future. Our programs are built with your career in mind, connecting you to the tools, faculty, and experiences that help you make your next move with confidence.

title: Accounting (MS) Virtual Information Session
description:
Achieve More With An Accounting MS Our  Accounting (MS)  program is packed with hands-on learning, case studies, and real-world projects. You won’t just learn accounting theory—you’ll know how to use it to tackle real challenges in the field. We’ll help you check all the boxes to be CPA-ready, with courses designed to meet certification requirements.   
 Accounting Virtual Information Session Join us for a brief 30-minute meeting July 31 at 1:00 PM (EST) Virtual via Zoom ➡️  Register Now  to receive session link! 
 Program Snapshot: 
 
 Rolling admission 
 Fall and Spring start 
 Classes on-campus and online 
 Full and part time options 
 Evening and weekend classes 
 33 credits 
 14:1 Student to faculty ratio 
 
 Join our session to learn how the program can help you develop strong knowledge of accounting principles and essential business practices to advance your career.

description:
This workshop will highlight how to evaluate sources, that is, how to assess the suitability of different kinds of information available the Montclair State University Libraries--namely, books, newspaper articles, and scholarly publications. description:

Come join the fun Thursday, September 4 at the Student Recreation Center and explore everything the Student Recreation Center has to offer this fall—from intramural and club sports to fitness classes, swim lessons, and unforgettable adventure trips.

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Pride and Progress: Celebrating LGBTQ+ and Disability Journeys
description:
Join Advocacy and Outreach for our 2nd Annual LGBTQ+ and Disability History and Awareness Month Flag Raising and Reception — a joyful celebration of identity, resilience, and community! 
 Pride and Progress brings together students, faculty, and staff to honor the rich histories and vibrant futures of LGBTQ+ and disability communities. Enjoy an inspiring flag-raising ceremony featuring an energetic MC, powerful speakers, and a special live performance you won’t want to miss. 
 After the ceremony, the celebration continues with: - Music & vibes - Delicious food - A hands-on craft activity - A photo activation station - Free LGBTQ+ and Disability Pride flags - Interactive tabling from campus partners 
 This event is about visibility, solidarity, and celebration — open to everyone, including allies! Come as you are, bring your friends, and help us raise our voices (and our flags!) in honor of progress, pride, and community power.

title: Khaṅkhaṇā: The Sound of Dancing Feet | The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble
description:
Nrityagram Dance Ensemble, hailed as one of India’s premier Odissi dance companies, has captured the world’s imagination with its extraordinary artistry and profound commitment to the ancient tradition of Odissi. We're excited to bring their performance  Khaṅkhaṇā  to Montclair State University this fall!  Show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK! 
   
 The company’s approach is rooted in the traditional Gurukula system, where students and teachers live in close harmony, absorbing not just dance technique but the very spirit of the Guru. The Ensemble’s performances have been described as “mysterious, eternal, and beautiful” by The New York Times, reflecting their ability to transport audiences to realms of magic, devotion, and ethereal beauty. 
   
 With its dedication to blending the wisdom of the past with the vibrancy of the present, Nrityagram continues to inspire awe around the world. Its performances, both ancient and contemporary, invite audiences to witness the timeless dance of love, union, and spiritual transcendence, embodied through the delicate, powerful movements of Odissi. 
   
 To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesday - Thursday, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM from September 30th to October 9th. See you there!

See you there!

title: Magnificent Bird / Book of Travelers | Two Song Cycles written and performed by Gabriel Kahane
description:
Experience two distinct works by acclaimed songwriter and performer Gabriel Kahane in one unforgettable day.  
   
 In this duo of intimate solo musical plays, composer Gabriel Kahane blends songwriting and storytelling for a singular, poignant theatrical event. Book of Travelers recounts the strangers he met on a 9,000-mile train journey through a divided America, and Magnificent Bird chronicles a year he spent entirely off-line, and the unexpected turbulence of living quietly. Performed on alternating nights, these two concept albums offer a relentless self-inquiry, and a searing portrait of a world in flux.  To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesday - Thursday, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM, and show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK. 
   
 Hailed as “one of the finest songwriters of the day” by The New Yorker, Gabriel Kahane is a musician and storyteller whose work spans the theater, club, and concert hall. Highlights of the 2024-25 season include a return to the New York stage in a production at Playwrights Horizons, performances at the Philharmonie de Paris, Wigmore Hall, and the Concertgebouw with fellow composer/performer Caroline Shaw, the premiere of a clarinet concerto for Anthony McGill, a solo debut with the Orchestre National de Lyon, and Kahane’s San Francisco conducting debut in Carla Kihlstedt’s Twenty-six Little Deaths. Kahane's collaborators range from Phoebe Bridgers, Paul Simon, Sufjan Stevens, and Sylvan Esso, to the Danish String Quartet, Roomful of Teeth, and Attacca Quartet. As a writer, he has been published by The New Yorker online and The New York Times; a newsletter and collection of essays on music, literature, and politics can be found at  gabrielkahane.substack.com . 
   
 4:00 pm Magnificent Bird 
 Run Time:  74 minutes, no intermission. 
   
 Magnificent Bird, is an intimate reflection on a year of self-imposed isolation during which the artist set out to write a song every day. With contributions from Andrew Bird, Chris Thile, Amelia Meath (Sylvan Esso), and Pulitzer Prize- winning composer Caroline Shaw, this collection explores the delicate balance between personal introspection and global crises. It’s a vivid musical snapshot of life during a tumultuous period, offering both a personal and universal meditation on modern-day existence. Based on Kahane’s fifth LP. 
   
 7:00 pm - Book of Travelers 
 Run Time:  70 minutes, no intermission 
   
 In Book of Travelers, Gabriel Kahane embarks on a journey across the United States, exploring the intersections of American identity and personal connection through the people he meets along the way. This powerful and emotional piece blends folk, classical, and pop influences to create a nuanced reflection on contemporary life in America. The work is a poignant and intimate exploration of what it means to traverse a country at a crossroads.
